items.name: English Language Arts Standards » Writing
items: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

items.name: Writing
items: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

items.name: Counting & Cardinality
items: Know number names and the count sequence.
Count to tell the number of objects.

items.name: Operations & Algebraic Thinking
items: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction.
Understand and apply properties of operations and the relationship between addition and subtraction.
Work with addition and subtraction equations.
Work with equal groups of objects to gain foundations for multiplication.
Represent and solve problems involving multiplication and division.
Understand properties of multiplication and the relationship between multiplication and division.
Solve problems involving the four operations, and identify and explain patterns in arithmetic.
Use the four operations with whole numbers to solve problems.
Gain familiarity with factors and multiples.

items.name: Number & Operations in Base Ten
items: Work with numbers 11-19 to gain foundations for place value.
Use place value understanding and properties of operations to add and subtract.
Use place value understanding and properties of operations to perform multi-digit arithmetic.
Generalize place value understanding for multi-digit whole numbers.
Perform operations with multi-digit whole numbers and with decimals to hundredths.

items.name: Measurement & Data
items: Classify objects and count the number of objects in each category.
Measure lengths indirectly and by iterating length units.
Measure and estimate lengths in standard units.
Relate addition and subtraction to length.
Solve problems involving measurement and estimation.
Geometric measurement: understand concepts of area and relate area to multiplication and to addition.
Solve problems involving measurement and conversion of measurements.
Geometric measurement: understand concepts of angle and measure angles.
Convert like measurement units within a given measurement system.
Geometric measurement: understand concepts of volume.

items.name: Geometry
items: Analyze, compare, create, and compose shapes.
Reason with shapes and their attributes.
Draw and identify lines and angles, and classify shapes by properties of their lines and angles.
Graph points on the coordinate plane to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Classify two-dimensional figures into categories based on their properties.
Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Draw construct, and describe geometrical figures and describe the relationships between them.
Solve real-life and mathematical problems involving angle measure, area, surface area, and volume.
Understand congruence and similarity using physical models, transparencies, or geometry software.
Understand and apply the Pythagorean Theorem.
Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving volume of cylinders, cones, and spheres.

items.name: Number & Operations Fractions
items: Develop understanding of fractions as numbers.
Extend understanding of fraction equivalence and ordering.
Understand decimal notation for fractions, and compare decimal fractions.
Use equivalent fractions as a strategy to add and subtract fractions.
Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division.

items.name: Ratios & Proportional Relationships
items: Understand ratio concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Analyze proportional relationships and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

items.name: The Number System
items: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division.
Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Apply and extend previous understandings of operations with fractions.
Know that there are numbers that are not rational, and approximate them by rational numbers.

items.name: Expressions & Equations
items: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.
Use properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.
Solve real-life and mathematical problems using numerical and algebraic expressions and equations.
Expressions and Equations Work with radicals and integer exponents.
Understand the connections between proportional relationships, lines, and linear equations.
Analyze and solve linear equations and pairs of simultaneous linear equations.

items.name: Statistics & Probability
items: Use random sampling to draw inferences about a population.
Draw informal comparative inferences about two populations.
Investigate chance processes and develop, use, and evaluate probability models.
Investigate patterns of association in bivariate data.

items.name: Functions
items: Use functions to model relationships between quantities.

items.name: The Real Number System
items: Extend the properties of exponents to rational exponents.
Use properties of rational and irrational numbers.

items.name: Quantities*
items: Reason quantitatively and use units to solve problems.

items.name: The Complex Number System
items: Perform arithmetic operations with complex numbers.
Represent complex numbers and their operations on the complex plane.
Use complex numbers in polynomial identities and equations.

items.name: Vector & Matrix Quantities
items: Represent and model with vector quantities.
Perform operations on matrices and use matrices in applications.

items.name: Seeing Structure in Expressions
items: Write expressions in equivalent forms to solve problems.

items.name: Arithmetic with Polynomials & Rational Expressions
items: Understand the relationship between zeros and factors of polynomials.
Use polynomial identities to solve problems.

items.name: Creating Equations*
items: Create equations that describe numbers or relationships.

items.name: Reasoning with Equations & Inequalities
items: Understand solving equations as a process of reasoning and explain the reasoning.
Solve equations and inequalities in one variable.
Represent and solve equations and inequalities graphically.

items.name: Interpreting Functions
items: Understand the concept of a function and use function notation.
Interpret functions that arise in applications in terms of the context.

items.name: Building Functions
items: Build a function that models a relationship between two quantities.
Build new functions from existing functions.

items.name: Linear, Quadratic, & Exponential Models*
items: Construct and compare linear, quadratic, and exponential models and solve problems.
Interpret expressions for functions in terms of the situation they model.

items.name: Trigonometric Functions
items: Extend the domain of trigonometric functions using the unit circle.
Model periodic phenomena with trigonometric functions.

items.name: Congruence
items: Experiment with transformations in the plane
Understand congruence in terms of rigid motions

items.name: Similarity, Right Triangles, & Trigonometry
items: Understand similarity in terms of similarity transformations
Define trigonometric ratios and solve problems involving right triangles

items.name: Circles
items: Understand and apply theorems about circles
Find arc lengths and areas of sectors of circles

items.name: Expressing Geometric Properties with Equations
items: Translate between the geometric description and the equation for a conic section
Use coordinates to prove simple geometric theorems algebraically

items.name: Geometric Measurement & Dimension
items: Explain volume formulas and use them to solve problems
Visualize relationships between two-dimensional and three-dimensional objects

items.name: Modeling with Geometry
items: Apply geometric concepts in modeling situations

items.name: Interpreting Categorical & Quantitative Data
items: Summarize, represent, and interpret data on a single count or measurement variable
Summarize, represent, and interpret data on two categorical and quantitative variables

items.name: Making Inferences & Justifying Conclusions
items: Understand and evaluate random processes underlying statistical experiments
Make inferences and justify conclusions from sample surveys, experiments, and observational studies

items.name: Conditional Probability & the Rules of Probability
items: Understand independence and conditional probability and use them to interpret data
Use the rules of probability to compute probabilities of compound events.

items.name: Using Probability to Make Decisions
items: Calculate expected values and use them to solve problems
Use probability to evaluate outcomes of decisions
